message:
A joint statement to the USA, Qatar and Egypt upon the conclusion of the round of talks in Doha:

In the last 48 hours, senior officials from the three countries acted as mediators in intensive talks with the aim of forging a deal for a ceasefire. The talks were serious, constructive and in a positive atmosphere.
Earlier today, the USA, with the support of Egypt and Qatar, submitted a proposal to reduce the differences between the parties based on President Biden's proposal and the UN Security Council's resolution of May 31.
The proposal enables the closing of the gaps between the parties in a way that will lead to the rapid implementation of the agreement.
Next week the technical teams will continue the work on the details of the implementation of the agreement.
The senior officials of the 3 countries will meet again in Cairo before next weekend in order to reach an agreement based on the proposal given today.
Deir al-Balah exodus

This is what one of the Gaza channels wrote about the attack on the towers in the Hamad neighborhood:

"يقصفون شقتك السكنية أمام عينيك أثناء نزوحك"..

They bomb your apartment, before your eyes, while you are evacuating....

##
It's not easy for them...
Palestinian channels report that 5 towers were bombed in Hamad neighborhood in Khan Yunis.
Fighter jets attack the towers in Hamad neighborhood in Khan Yunis after the evacuation notice 👆👆

A Gazan forced to evacuate following the IDF spokesman's announcement in Arabic, whining while riding a horse-drawn cart:

We are evacuating now, I swear by Allah that I do not know where we are going... We swear that we do not know where we are going.... May Allah take revenge on them... May Allah have mercy on us...
Gaza sources report the movement of tanks near the Salah al-Din axis, near the Abu Houli junction in the south of Deir al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip.

The Palestinians report that the IDF has issued specific evacuation notices to the residents of 6 towers in the Hamad neighborhood in Khan Yunis. These are the towers that are required to evacuate:
G4
G5
E4
E7
F7
F6

A Gazan writes:

‏المفروض جماعتنا يشغلوا افيخاي ادرعي مدير مكتب الأعلامي الحكومي في غز ة 
بيحرك الناس بمنشور من مكان لمكان

"Our guys" should hire Avichay Adraee (IDF spokesman in Arabic-AA) as the director of the government information office in Gaza.
In one post, he manages to move people from one place to another...
Gazan sources: Yesterday and today, in the center of the Gaza Strip, Hamas executed a number of collaborators with Israel.
The Palestinians report IDF artillery fire in eastern Deir al-Balah over the past few hours as well as in the Qarara area in northern Khan Yunis - something that helps to "speed up the evacuees"...

More documentation of the evacuation from eastern Deir al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip

Please note that the evacuation is also carried out from residential areas with buildings that were not damaged by attacks - areas where the IDF has not yet maneuvered.

Evacuation from east of Deir al-Balah:
Palestinian sources report that thousands of residents of eastern Deir al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip have evacuated to the west following the instructions of the IDF spokesman.

The municipality of Deir al-Balah published a statement that the evacuation announced today by the IDF spokesman will prevent access to 10 water wells and two water reservoirs in addition to the fact that it will endanger residents who will try to reach 3 more water wells. According to the municipality of Deir al-Balah, a serious water crisis is expected to arise in the center of the Gaza Strip.

The correspondent of the Lebanese Al-Manar channel (Hezbollah-affiliated) claims that the fire that broke out in the car in the Al-Qasmia area in southern Lebanon did not happen as a result of an attack. He did not specify the cause of the fire.
Arab media reports about a magnitude 5.2 earthquake that was felt a few minutes ago in Syria, Lebanon and Turkey (the epicenter of the earthquake was in the Hama district in Syria).
And so Mr. Salameh was eliminated, according to the IDF spokesperson...

Hezbollah officially announces the death of

Ibrahim Salameh

He was killed in a UAV attack with an advantage 👆 in southern Lebanon.

Number 412
Video of the vehicle that was attacked in Lebanon earlier today.

Lebanese sources are reporting an Israeli UAV attack a short time ago on a vehicle in the Qasmia area, near the village of Barj Rahal in the Tyre governorate in southern Lebanon.
One injured. The vehicle was passing in the area between a UNIFIL post and a Lebanese army post.

It's always nice to see that "celebs" also cooperate and take part in popular programs in the Israeli prison:
The Palestinian member of parliament on behalf of Hamas, Sheikh Mahmoud Khatib, from Bethlehem, was released from prison in Israel yesterday after 10 months.
Faiz Mesek from Hebron, who went straight to his barber, and the red-haired Abdullah Abu Shahidm, from the village of Abu Shahidm in the Ramallah governorate, were also released and honored with before and after pictures.

All stuck to the prison diet.

Ahmed Abu Damos, the East Jerusalem lawyer who managed the largest Palestinian Telegram channel (about a million followers), in which he regularly posted harsh inflammatory words against Israel.
As mentioned, he was released yesterday👆 after ten months of administrative detention. Attached are photos of him before and after.

Meanwhile, while Hezbollah is busy with propaganda videos, unofficial Lebanese channels report that Ibrahim Salameh, a Hezbollah operative, was killed in the Israeli strike earlier today in Aitaroun in southern Lebanon.

Hezbollah has released a polished propaganda video lasting over four minutes, showcasing for the first time the underground facility "Imad 4," named after Imad Mughniyeh, the Hezbollah commander killed in Syria in 2008. 

The facility appears to be dug into rocky terrain and is spacious enough to accommodate truck movements. The video features missiles, rockets, and launch systems, accompanied by familiar incitement from Nasrallah with Hebrew subtitles.

Hezbollah aims to enhance its image in an effort to deter Israel from starting a war against it. Hezbollah was considerate enough to also release a slimmed-down version for easier viewing on mobile devices.
The military wing of Hamas recently released a video claiming to show a suicide drone being launched towards a building in Khan Younis.
Lebanese channels report casualties in the IDF attack in the Aitaroun area in southern Lebanon.

IDF spokesperson in Arabic recently issued new evacuation instructions for residents of the Gaza Strip:

1. Residents of the eastern neighborhoods of Deir al-Balah (central Gaza, an area where the IDF has not yet maneuvered) are requested to evacuate.

2. Residents of Qarara, Mawasi, Jalaa, Hamed, and al-Nasser in northern Khan Younis are requested to evacuate.

3. Due to the evacuation in Khan Younis, the humanitarian area is being reduced (the section highlighted in red on the map at the expense of the humanitarian area marked in yellow).

##
An interesting evacuation, in light of the ongoing talks today in Doha...

The Ukrainian invasion of Kursk in Russia: Ukrainian civilians are leaving reviews on Google Maps for sites in Kursk...

The Ukrainians greatly enjoy sticking it to the Russians.

Hamas official Hussam Badran on the negotiations in Doha:

“Hamas views the talks on prisoner release and a ceasefire from a strategic perspective, aiming to end the aggression against Gaza.

From Hamas's perspective, the current talks are part of a plan to implement what has already been agreed upon in the past.

Any agreement reached must include a comprehensive ceasefire, a full withdrawal from Gaza, the return of displaced persons to their homes, and the reconstruction of the strip, alongside a prisoner exchange deal.”

3. "When I'm president, we will deport the foreign Jihad sympathisers and we will deport them very quickly, and Hamas supporters will be gone. 

If you hate America, if you want to eliminate Israel, then we don't want you in our country, we really don't want you in our country.

I will ban refugee settlements from terror-infested areas like the Gaza Strip, and we will arrest the pro-Hamas thugs that vandalized federal property and make life very difficult in this country for a lot of people."

2. "When I'm back in the oval office I will support Israel's right to win its war on terror. They have a right to win that war. And I will give Israel the support that it needs to win, but I do want them to win fast. Wouldn't that be nice? If they could win fast. We have to let them win fast.

We will restore stability and peace in the Middle East and we will be sure that it'll be peace through strength."
1. "Israel is a tiny little spot compared to these giant land masses. Surely a tiny spot. I actually said - is there any way of getting (more)... So tiny."

Trump has stirred up social networks with his remarks at a conference against anti-Semitism tonight, with the Israeli flag behind him:

1. Israel is so tiny... is there any way of getting (more).

2. Israel should be allowed to defeat terrorism. It has a right to do so. It would be nice if it happened quickly. I will support that.

3. I will deport and arrest all Hamas and Jihad supporters in the US

Here are the full quotes 👇👇

Following Abu Mazen's announcement that he will arrive in the Gaza Strip, a Gazan writes on social media:

اي حد جاي ع غزة حتى لو الريس هاتلنا شباشب وشامبو معك

For everyone who comes to Gaza, even if it's the Rais (the President, Abu Mazen - AA), bring us some slippers and shampoo...
Sicily, Italy: Mount Etna in a spectacular night show that caused the closure of the island's airport for many hours.
